page.title: 05VILLAGE HALL BRAISHFIELD
page.content: It is a modern looking building designed to cut down on maintenance costs, with brick interior and window frames that do not need painting. It has a large main hall, a stage, a large committee room, good sized kitchen, a bar, cloakroom and toilets with facility for disabled persons. The first recorded mention of the hall was in Braishfield Village Association minutes of September 1977, an open meeting was called in November 1978, and the hall was officially opened by Lady Romsey on 21st January 1982. The land was donated, and money raised by grants, fund raising and a generous donation from the Womens' Institute on sale of their hall site. Many groups use the hall, W.I., Scouts, Cubs, Brownies, Flower Arrangers, Senior Citizens, Horticultural Socy. Very popular for private functions.
